reviewText: Here is a book with a solid purpose. It helps the senior executive in charge of deciding what to do with complex databases know that he doesn't know enough. Kolb is a categorical mind at work and uses words that are just plain enough to let the reader grasp his own lack of understanding. It's sort of like looking at a pile of bricks and not having the faintest skill at building a wall. Or reading a catalogue where the words flow to a point where you exclaim, "I need that!. Read this book to learn what you don't know and where to turn to get the job done. You can save yourself and your co-workers a lot of grief while forging your way to a superior solution.
title: Business Intelligence in Plain Language: A practical guide to Data Mining and Business Analytics
